Remaking Boston

An Environmental History of the City

and Its Surroundings

Panel Discussion

Moderator: Anthony Penna, Northeastern University, Emeritus

Wednesday, May 5th - 6:00 PM
5:30 Refreshments; 6:00 Discussion

Reservations required: register online HERE or call (617) 646-0560.


Massachusetts Historical Society
1154 Boylston Street
Boston, MA 02215
Main number: (617) 536-1608

The MHS is pleased to announce the recent publication of an important collection of essays from a 2006 MHS conference on the environmental history of Boston. Remaking Boston: An Environmental History of the City and Its Surroundings, edited by Anthony N. Penna (Northeastern University) and Conrad Edick Wright (MHS), offers contributions by geologists, botanists, urban planners, a cartographer, and a geographer as well as historians that paint a valuable picture of the city's complicated environmental development since the arrival of European settlers in the early 17th century. Copies of Remaking Boston will be available for purchase at the event.

The Panelists:
Anthony N. Penna is professor emeritus of history at Northeastern University

Conrad Edick Wright is the Ford Editor of Publications and director of research at the Massachusetts Historical Society

Brian Donahue is associate professor of American environmental studies at Brandeis University

Karl Haglund has been project manager for the Massachusetts Department of Conservation and Recreation's new Charles River Basin for over twenty years

James C. O'Connell is a planner and historian with the National Park Service's Northeast Atlantic Region Office in Boston
